block.p: The condition of Rhode Island wide receiver BOBBY APGAR, who was severely injured last month in a car crash that killed two others, has been upgraded from critical to serious. He has been moved from the intensive care unit at St. Luke's Hospital in Manhattan, a hospital spokesman said yesterday.

Apgar, 22, of Easton, Pa., injured his head and neck when the car in which he was riding smashed into a utility pole and a tree in Manhattan at about 4 A.M. on Oct. 28. A Rhode Island senior, Curtis Whiting of Hackensack, N.J., and another man died in the crash. The driver, BRIAN FERRILL, 23, of Hackensack, sustained head and chest injuries. He was charged with drunken driving and other counts.

MIKE SCAHILL, a St. Luke's spokesman, said that Apgar is able to move all four limbs and is conscious, but he declined to discuss further details of his condition or long-term prognosis.
